--- title: "Data Acquisition" author: "Sherliana Setiawan" matriculation number: "534820" --- # DATA ACQUISITION ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- # CHALLENGE 1: API ::: {.cell hash='02_data_acquisition_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_e95d166e9218eb0e02b6df69d3461cf3'} ```{.r .cell-code} # load libraries library(tidyverse) install.packages("devtools", repos = "http://cran.rstudio.com/") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> Installing package into 'C:/Users/USER/AppData/Local/R/win-library/4.3' #> (as 'lib' is unspecified) ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> package 'devtools' successfully unpacked and MD5 sums checked #> #> The downloaded binary packages are in #> C:\Users\USER\AppData\Local\Temp\Rtmpywc05u\downloaded_packages ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} devtools::install_github("zumbov2/deeplr") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> Skipping install of 'deeplr' from a github remote, the SHA1 (b9206467) has not changed since last install. #> Use `force = TRUE` to force installation ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} my_auth_key = "05bc2a53-360f-1d6a-540f-2b880ad44d62:fx" text_to_be_translated = "La seule facon de savoir ce qui se passe est de perturber le systeme." translated_text <- deeplr::translate2( text = text_to_be_translated, target_lang = "EN", auth_key = my_auth_key ) knitr::kable(text_to_be_translated, caption = 'text to be translated') ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} Table: text to be translated |x | |:---------------------------------------------------------------------| |La seule facon de savoir ce qui se passe est de perturber le systeme. | ::: ```{.r .cell-code} knitr::kable(translated_text, caption = 'translated.text') ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} Table: translated.text |x | |:-------------------------------------------------------------------| |The only way to find out what is going on is to disrupt the system. | ::: ::: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- # CHALLENGE 2: WEB SCRAPPING ROSEBIKES.DE ::: {.cell hash='02_data_acquisition_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_370f3c0b11aeb6926d4de54d08d1bf50'} ```{.r .cell-code} # Load libraries library(rvest) # For web scraping library(stringr) # For string manipulation library(dplyr) # For data manipulation # Read the HTML content of the webpage url = "https://www.rosebikes.de/" rosebikes = read_html(url) # Extract product names from the HTML using CSS selector (selector gadget) ".products-slider-tile__product-name" product_name = rosebikes %>% html_nodes(".products-slider-tile__product-name") %>% html_text() # Extract product costs from the HTML using CSS selector ".product-tile-price__current-value", # remove non-numeric characters, such as currency symbols and spaces product_cost = rosebikes %>% html_nodes(".product-tile-price__current-value ") %>% html_text() %>% str_replace_all("[^0-9.,]+", "") # Remove any remaining non-numeric characters, such as additional symbols or text product_cost = sub("[^0-9.,]", "", product_cost) # Replace commas with dots to convert the prices into a numeric format product_cost = sub(",", ".", product_cost) # Remove the first dot if it represents a thousand separator product_cost = sub("(?<=\\d)\\.(?=\\d{3})", "", product_cost, perl = TRUE) # Remove trailing ".00" from the prices product_cost = sub("\\.00$", "", product_cost) # Convert the prices to numeric format product_cost = as.numeric(product_cost) # Create a tibble (data frame) combining the product names and prices product = data.frame(product_name, product_cost) product = tibble(product_name, product_cost) # Output the product tibble product ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} head(product,10) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: :::
